◇ ~せい: means because of or due to.  
・This is used to indicate the cause of a negative result or situation. 
・Often implies the speaker’s criticism or complaint towards the cause. 
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form.  
・雨のせいで試合が中止になった。The game was canceled due to the rain.  
・彼のせいで遅刻した。I was late because of him.  
・勉強しなかったせいで試験に落ちた。I failed the exam because I didn’t study.

◇ ~おかげ: means thanks to or owing to.  
・This is used to indicate the cause of a positive result or situation. 
・Often implies the speaker’s gratitude or appreciation towards the cause.   
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form.  
・先生のおかげで英語が上達した。I improved my English thanks to my teacher.  
・運動のおかげで健康になった。I became healthy because of exercise.  
・友達のおかげで楽しい時間を過ごした。I had a good time because of my friends.

◇ ~もの: means because or since.  
・This is used to indicate the reason or cause of something, especially when it is obvious or self-evident. 
・Can also imply an excuse or justification for something.  
・It is usually attached to a verb in the plain form.  
・子供なもので、わからないことが多い。Since I’m a child, there are many things I don’t understand.  
・病気なものだから、休ませてください。Please let me rest because I’m sick.  
・好きなものだから、食べすぎた。I ate too much because I liked it.

◇ ~のだから: means because or since.  
・This is used to emphasize the reason or cause of something especially when it is obvious or self-evident. 
・Used to assert one’s opinion or attitude often with a request or demand for the listener. 
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form, followed by のだから.  
・先生なのだから、教えてください。Please teach me since you are a teacher.  
・約束したのだから、守ってください。Please keep your promise because you promised.  
・親友なのだから、信じてください。Please believe me since you are my best friend.

◇ ~をきっかけに: means triggered by, taking something as an opportunity, on the occasion of or starting from.  
・This is used to indicate the trigger or opportunity for something to happen or change. 
・Focus on something happened as a result of an event or situation that served as a trigger or opportunity. 
・It is usually attached to a noun, followed by をきっかけに.  
・留学をきっかけに英語を勉強した。I studied English taking studying abroad as an opportunity.  
・出会いをきっかけに恋に落ちた。I fell in love on the occasion of meeting him/her.  
・事故をきっかけに運転をやめた。I stopped driving after the accident.

◇ ~がきっかけで: means means triggered by, because of or due to.  
・This is used to express that something happened as a result of an event or situation that served as a trigger or opportunity.  
・Focus on the event or situation that caused something to happen.  
・彼との出会いがきっかけで、私は音楽に興味を持つようになった。I became interested in music triggered by meeting him. 
・風邪をひいたことがきっかけで、健康に気をつけるようになった。I started to take care of my health, triggered by catching a cold. 
・留学生と話したことがきっかけで、英語の勉強を始めた。I started studying English, triggered by talking to an exchange student.

◇ ~わけだ: means that’s why or it means that.  
・This is used to indicate the logical conclusion or reason for something, based on the previous context or common knowledge. 
・Logical conclusion or explanation based on some evidence or premise. 
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form, followed by わけだ.  
・彼は日本人です。日本語が話せるわけです。He is Japanese. That’s why he can speak Japanese.  
・この店は人気があります。いつも混んでいるわけです。This store is popular. It means that it is always crowded.  
・明日は試験です。勉強しなければならないわけです。Tomorrow is the exam. That’s why I have to study.

◇ ~以来: means since or ever since.  
・This is used to indicate the starting point of a period of time, until the present or another point in time.  
・Used to indicate that something has continued or changed from a certain point of time until now.  
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in te-form, followed by 以来.  
・私は彼に会って以来好きになりました。I liked him since I met him.  
・彼女は子供のときピアノを習い始めて以来ずっと弾いています。She has been playing piano ever since she started learning it when she was a child.  
・当社は設立以来、毎年業績が右肩上がりだ。Since its establishment, the company's performance has steadily increased every year.

◇ ~によって: means depending on, due to or according to.  
・This is used to indicate the agent, method, cause or degree of something. 
・Used to express the cause or reason of something, especially when it is negative or unfavourable. 
・It is usually attached to a noun, followed by によって.  
・この本は彼によって書かれました。This book was written by him.  
・結果は人によって違います。The results vary depending on the person.  
・地震は台風によって引き起こされました。The earthquake was caused by the typhoon.
